page.title: 07CENSUS STATISTICS,EAST COKER
page.content: Between 1971 and 1981 there was a{fall {in population}in the parish of{2.98%. The total number of residents is 1738; of these 843(48.5%)were male and 895 (51.5%)were female,which gives a difference of 3% more females than males. In 1981 almost a quarter of the population (i.e.{24.6%}) was of {pensionable age.}This is a fairly high proportion which might indicate that the average age of the population is increasing.This is also shown by the relatively{low proportion}(17.8%) of children{under}the age of{16. These trends may arise from the decline of industry in the parish (closures of the saw mills and rope works),and the{popularity}of the village for{retirement. A residential home for the elderly has recently been opened.
